alert.note: Alert for Larimer; Weld (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 21 at 4:07PM MST until December 21 at 4:45PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver Colorado has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northern Weld County in northeastern Colorado... Northeastern Larimer County in north central Colorado... * Until 445 PM MST. * At 406 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located 4 miles north of Rockport, or 12 miles south of Cheyenne, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and blowing snow with visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 285 and 297. Locations impacted include... Grover, Carr, Rockport, Hereford, Natural Fort and Pawnee Buttes. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.
